outputs.output_descr: The Government services reform project is intended to address the issues related to government services provided by Ministries to citizens and businesses and implement appropriate solutions to optimize those services, minimize the cost, red tape and paper work, as well as improve the capacity of the human resources. This project will also address the reforms of the ministry covering policies improvement, organizational restructuring, process improvement, human resources development and information technology infrastructure modernization.

The Government services reform project is intended to address the issues related to government services provided by Ministries to citizens and businesses and implement appropriate solutions to optimize those services, minimize the cost, red tape and paper work, as well as improve the capacity of the human resources. This project will also address the reforms of the ministry covering policies improvement, organizational restructuring, process improvement, human resources development and information technology infrastructure modernization.
memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Ministry of Communication and Technology/Public Post Establishment (Syrian Post) considered as an important agency that provides various services to citizens and business sector. The project provides technical assistance to enhance Syrian Post institutional and administrative capacities, to computerize its main services, and to build its human resources. Output deliverables were divided into five tracks:
Track 1: Quality improvement of the supplied services 
1.	 Improve the quality of current services
2.	Develop new financial and postal services
3.	Supervision of  the implementation of these improvements.
Track 2: Human resources training and development: 
4.	Prepare and implement a continuous training plan depending on the concepts of career development plans.
5.	Prepare and implement a motivation plan by linking salaries with employee's productivity and performance. This plan might help attracting and maintaining highly-qualified human resources.
6.	Supervise the implementation of the training plan.
Track 3: Improvement of service delivery environment: 
1.	Develop and modernize citizen centers delivering postal services
2.	Develop and modernize marketing plans in order to promote postal services.
3.	Enhance and develop new postal office and centers all over the country.
4.	Develop and modernize processing tools and devices used for Postal services.
5.	Develop and modernize distribution vehicles and equipments.
Track 4: Computerization of Postal services
This track considers the computerization of the following services:  
•	Postal transfer service
•	Express Mail service
•	Official Mail service
•	Formal- paperwork correspondence service
•	Invoice payment service
Track 5: Restructuring of administrative & organizational environment: 
1.	Re-organize the administrative procedures within the establishment
2.	Modernize and develop administrative structure of the establishment.
3.	Modernize and develop the internal bylaws of the establishment
4.	Create a quality-management system that would help the establishment to obtain administrative quality certificate (ISO 9000).

The Government services reform project is intended to address the issues related to government services provided by Ministries to citizens and businesses and implement appropriate solutions to optimize those services, minimize the cost, red tape and paper work, as well as improve the capacity of the human resources. This project will also address the reforms of the ministry covering policies improvement, organizational restructuring, process improvement, human resources development and information technology infrastructure modernization.
Memorandum of understanding with National agency for networking services (NANS) aims to create a framework for cooperation and coordination between the Ministry of Communications and Technology (MoCT), the National Agency of Network services (NANS) and UNDP-GSR, in order to provide technical assistance for the activation of electronic-signature law in Syria and for building required capacity in accordance with the needs of the NANS in this specific area. Outputs delivered according to MoU are the following:
1.	Set-up an execution plan for implementing digital signature in Syria considering readiness environment and local needs, by focusing on consecutive implementation phases.
2.	Conduct and specify the required expertise and build ToRs to ensure execution of the above mentioned plan, participate and supervise the related contracting process.
3.	Provide expertise for supervising the establishment of PKI infrastructure as per the national plan for the activation of use of digital signature.
4.	Develop necessary recommendations to regulate the use of electronic signature during the transition period until the project of electronic signature is up and running.
5.	 Develop general technical specifications for digital-signature systems and supervise their implementation. 
6.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for root CA and supervise its implementation.
7.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for government CA and supervise its implementation.
8.	Conduct, supervise, and review the general tender book for the implementation of root and governmental CAs' systems; and follow up contracting process.
9.	Supervise the implementation and operation of root and governmental CAs' systems and their final acceptance.
10.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for public CAs and supervise their implementation.

project_descr: Government Services Reforms and Modernization Programme
